page.title: 07Haulage-Leck area
page.content: In our block there are three haulage firms called D. Bradshaw & Son, Shuttleworths and J.Pelters & Son. D. Bradshaw has his main work shop and place where he keeps his wagons in the old station yard. Bradshaws don't specialise in any particular kind of haulage. Shuttleworths on the other hand transport fertilizer and mainly sheep and livestock. They work mainly from Cowan Bridge where they live. Pelter's have their base in Whittington and they have mostly tipper lorries. Their lorries help in Motorway contracting and they helped to build the M6. Some of the haulage is from the I.C.I. warehouse which is the other big warehouse in the area. I.C.I. sells fertiliser, silo sheets and silo bags. Farmers pick up those items from there.
